2024-02-03.title: American Fiction
2024-02-03.synopsis: AMERICAN FICTION is Cord Jefferson's hilarious directorial debut, which confronts our culture’s obsession with reducing people to outrageous stereotypes. Jeffrey Wright stars as Monk, a frustrated novelist who’s fed up with the establishment profiting from “Black” entertainment that relies on tired and offensive tropes. To prove his point, Monk uses a pen name to write an outlandish “Black” book of his own, a book that propels him to the heart of hypocrisy and the madness he claims to disdain.

2024-02-03.title: Argylle
2024-02-03.synopsis:
From the twisted mind of Matthew Vaughn (Kingsman franchise, Kick-Ass) comes Argylle, a razor-witted, reality-bending, globe-encircling spy thriller.

Bryce Dallas Howard (Jurassic World franchise) is Elly Conway, the reclusive author of a series of best-selling espionage novels, whose idea of bliss is a night at home with her computer and her cat, Alfie. But when the plots of Elly’s fictional books—which center on secret agent Argylle and his mission to unravel a global spy syndicate—begin to mirror the covert actions of a real-life spy organization, quiet evenings at home become a thing of the past.

Accompanied by Aiden (Oscar® winner Sam Rockwell), a cat-allergic spy, Elly (carrying Alfie in her backpack) races across the world to stay one step ahead of the killers as the line between Elly’s fictional world and her real one begins to blur.

2024-02-03.title: Poor Things
2024-02-03.synopsis: From filmmaker Yorgos Lanthimos and producer Emma Stone comes the incredible tale and fantastical evolution of Bella Baxter (Stone), a young woman brought back to life by the brilliant and unorthodox scientist Dr. Godwin Baxter (Dafoe).

2024-02-03.title: All Of Us Strangers
2024-02-03.synopsis: One night in his near-empty tower block in contemporary London, Adam (Andrew Scott) has a chance encounter with a mysterious neighbor Harry (Paul Mescal), which punctures the rhythm of his everyday life. As a relationship develops between them, Adam is preoccupied with memories of the past and finds himself drawn back to the suburban town where he grew up, and the childhood home where his parents (Claire Foy and Jamie Bell), appear to be living, just as they were on the day they died, 30 years before.

2024-02-03.title: Chicken Run: Dawn of the Nugget
2024-02-03.synopsis: After escaping from Tweedy's farm, Ginger and all the chickens living the dream in their peaceful island sanctuary, far from the dangers of the human world.

2024-02-03.title: The Zone of Interest
2024-02-03.synopsis: The commandant of Auschwitz, Rudolf Höss, and his wife Hedwig, strive to build a dream life for their family in a house and garden next to the camp.

2024-02-03.title: The Holdovers
2024-02-03.synopsis: From acclaimed director Alexander Payne, The Holdovers follows a curmudgeonly teacher (Paul Giamatti) at a New England prep school who is forced to remain on campus during the holidays to babysit the handful of students with nowhere to go. Eventually he forms an unlikely bond with one of them -- a damaged, brainy troublemaker (newcomer Dominic Sessa) -- and with the school’s head cook, who lost a son in Vietnam (Da’Vine Joy Randolph). With outstanding critical acclaim, The Holdovers is now the winner of 2 Golden Globes for Best Actor (Comedy) for Paul Giamatti and Best Supporting Actress for Da’Vine Joy Randolph.

2024-02-03.title: Maestro
2024-02-03.synopsis: Maestro is a towering and fearless love story chronicling the lifelong relationship between Leonard Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre Cohn Bernstein. A love letter to life and art, Maestro at its core is an emotionally epic portrayal of family and love.

2024-02-03.title: Society of the Snow
2024-02-03.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-02-03.title: DocHouse: Miucha: The Voice Of Bossa Nova
2024-02-03.synopsis:
Brazilian singer Miúcha was associated with some of Bossa Nova's biggest (male) legends - she was known as the sister of Chico Buarque, the pupil of Vinicius de Moraes and the wife of the 'father' of the genre, João Gilberto. But her own role in the developing movement has been neglected.

A gorgeous film to watch, set to the soundtrack of Miúcha's music and saturated with Bossa Nova vibes, Miúcha: The Voice of Bossa Nova tells her story through 16mm home movies, diaries, personal letters and her own expressive watercolour paintings, animated for the film.

Even as she struggled to find her own voice in the shadow of her revered husband, Miúcha went on to earn unprecedented success, becoming a symbol of female resilience and a musical legend.

2024-02-03.title: DocHouse: The Disappearance Of Shere Hite
2024-02-03.synopsis:
Feminist researcher Shere Hite changed the discussion around women's sexuality with her groundbreaking studies in the 1970s and 80s, and her books (including The Hite Report) became best-sellers. But both her methodology and her message came under criticism in the backlash from this popularity, and slowly but surely Shere was ridiculed and squeezed out of the mainstream - and eventually out of popular consciousness.

Director Nicole Newnham (Crip Camp) recovers Shere Hite from the margins of history, feminism and academia, exploring the charismatic former model's rise and fall from prominence. Using a treasure trove of archive footage, The Disappearance of Shere Hite transports viewers back to a time of great societal change and transformation around sexuality. It rediscovers a pioneer who has had an unmistakable influence on current conversations around gender and sexuality, and asks what led to Shere's erasure.

2024-02-04.title: Maestro
2024-02-04.synopsis: Maestro is a towering and fearless love story chronicling the lifelong relationship between Leonard Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre Cohn Bernstein. A love letter to life and art, Maestro at its core is an emotionally epic portrayal of family and love.

2024-02-04.title: Chicken Run: Dawn of the Nugget
2024-02-04.synopsis: After escaping from Tweedy's farm, Ginger and all the chickens living the dream in their peaceful island sanctuary, far from the dangers of the human world.

2024-02-04.title: Poor Things
2024-02-04.synopsis: From filmmaker Yorgos Lanthimos and producer Emma Stone comes the incredible tale and fantastical evolution of Bella Baxter (Stone), a young woman brought back to life by the brilliant and unorthodox scientist Dr. Godwin Baxter (Dafoe).

From the twisted mind of Matthew Vaughn (Kingsman franchise, Kick-Ass) comes Argylle, a razor-witted, reality-bending, globe-encircling spy thriller.

Bryce Dallas Howard (Jurassic World franchise) is Elly Conway, the reclusive author of a series of best-selling espionage novels, whose idea of bliss is a night at home with her computer and her cat, Alfie. But when the plots of Elly’s fictional books—which center on secret agent Argylle and his mission to unravel a global spy syndicate—begin to mirror the covert actions of a real-life spy organization, quiet evenings at home become a thing of the past.

Accompanied by Aiden (Oscar® winner Sam Rockwell), a cat-allergic spy, Elly (carrying Alfie in her backpack) races across the world to stay one step ahead of the killers as the line between Elly’s fictional world and her real one begins to blur.

2024-02-04.title: The Holdovers
2024-02-04.synopsis: From acclaimed director Alexander Payne, The Holdovers follows a curmudgeonly teacher (Paul Giamatti) at a New England prep school who is forced to remain on campus during the holidays to babysit the handful of students with nowhere to go. Eventually he forms an unlikely bond with one of them -- a damaged, brainy troublemaker (newcomer Dominic Sessa) -- and with the school’s head cook, who lost a son in Vietnam (Da’Vine Joy Randolph). With outstanding critical acclaim, The Holdovers is now the winner of 2 Golden Globes for Best Actor (Comedy) for Paul Giamatti and Best Supporting Actress for Da’Vine Joy Randolph.

2024-02-04.title: American Fiction
2024-02-04.synopsis: AMERICAN FICTION is Cord Jefferson's hilarious directorial debut, which confronts our culture’s obsession with reducing people to outrageous stereotypes. Jeffrey Wright stars as Monk, a frustrated novelist who’s fed up with the establishment profiting from “Black” entertainment that relies on tired and offensive tropes. To prove his point, Monk uses a pen name to write an outlandish “Black” book of his own, a book that propels him to the heart of hypocrisy and the madness he claims to disdain.

2024-02-04.title: Rustin
2024-02-04.synopsis: The architect of 1963’s momentous March on Washington, Bayard Rustin was one of the greatest activists and organizers the world has ever known. He challenged authority, never apologized for who he was, what he believed, or who he desired. And he did not back down. He made history, and in turn, he was forgotten. Directed by DGA award and five-time Tony award winner George C. Wolfe and starring Emmy award winner Colman Domingo, Rustin shines a long overdue spotlight on the extraordinary man who, alongside giants like the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr., Adam Clayton Powell Jr., and Ella Baker, dared to imagine a different world, and inspired a movement in a march toward freedom. Produced by Academy award winner Bruce Cohen, Higher Ground's Tonia Davis and George C. Wolfe, the film features an all-star cast including Chris Rock, Glynn Turman, Jeffrey Wright and Audra McDonald.

2024-02-04.title: Characters of Jeffrey Wright: The French Dispatch
2024-02-04.synopsis:
Playing as part of the Characters of Jeffrey Wright season, in association with We Are Parable. 

Wes Anderson’s latest film is a love letter to journalists set in an outpost of an American magazine in a fictional 20th-century French city and brings to life a collection of stories published in The French Dispatch.

2024-02-04.title: The Zone of Interest
2024-02-04.synopsis: The commandant of Auschwitz, Rudolf Höss, and his wife Hedwig, strive to build a dream life for their family in a house and garden next to the camp.

2024-02-04.title: Napoleon
2024-02-04.synopsis: Napoleon is a spectacle-filled action epic that details the checkered rise and fall of the iconic French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, played by Oscar®-winner Joaquin Phoenix. Against a stunning backdrop of large-scale filmmaking orchestrated by legendary director Ridley Scott, the film captures Bonaparte's relentless journey to power through the prism of his addictive, volatile relationship with his one true love, Josephine, showcasing his visionary military and political tactics against some of the most dynamic practical battle sequences ever filmed.

2024-02-04.title: PET SHOP BOYS DREAMWORLD: THE GREATEST HITS LIVE
2024-02-04.synopsis:
Pet Shop Boys bring their critically-acclaimed greatest hits tour, Dreamworld, to movie theatres worldwide for two nights only!
Captured live at Copenhagen’s Royal Arena, Neil Tennant and Chris Lowe put on an exhilarating performance, featuring a lavish stage show, full back-up band and mesmerizing visual backdrops, in front of an exuberant, sold-out audience. With film direction from leading live performance director David Barnard in a 14-camera shoot, this brand new concert film includes all of Pet Shop Boys' greatest hits including West End Girls, Suburbia, Opportunities (Let’s Make Lots of Money), Left to My Own Devices, Rent, Domino Dancing, Love Comes Quickly, Always on My Mind, What Have I Done to Deserve This and It's a Sin.

2024-02-04.title: Anyone But You
2024-02-04.synopsis: In the comedy Anyone But You, Bea (Sydney Sweeney) and Ben (Glen Powell) look like the perfect couple, but after an amazing first date something happens that turns their fiery hot attraction ice cold - until they find themselves unexpectedly thrust together at a destination wedding in Australia. So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

2024-02-04.title: Society of the Snow
2024-02-04.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-02-04.title: WHAM!
2024-02-04.synopsis:
In 1982, the best of friends and still teenagers - George Michael and Andrew Ridgeley as WHAM! set out to conquer the world. By June of 1986 they played their very last gig at Wembley Stadium having done exactly that.

Now for the very first time, told in their own words, the amazing story of how in four years they dominated the charts around the world with timeless and classic pop songs. Hit after hit - Club Tropicana, Wake Me Up Before You Go Go, Freedom, I’m Your Man and of course Last Christmas.

Their time in the spotlight was white-hot, becoming the very first western pop act to play in China.

It was a time that both encapsulated and epitomised not just their youth, but also those of the many millions of fans that adored them.

With unprecedented access to both George and Andrew’s personal archive including remarkable and never-before-seen footage, alongside rare, candid and previously unheard interviews, WHAM! charts their incredible journey from school friends to superstars.

2024-02-04.title: Samsara
2024-02-04.synopsis:
Samsara is the Buddhist cycle of death and reincarnation. From the temples of Laos, alongside with teenage monks, we will accompany a soul in its transit from one body to another through the bardo. The words of the "Tibetan Book of the Dead" will be our guide to avoid getting lost in the afterlife. A luminous and sonorous journey that will lead us to reincarnate on the beaches of Zanzibar, where groups of women work in seaweed farms.

CONTENT WARNING: This film contains flickering or flashing lights that may affect those with photosensitive epilepsy.

2024-02-04.title: DocHouse: Our Body
2024-02-04.synopsis:
In the gynaecology ward of a Parisian public hospital, veteran observational filmmaker Claire Simon questions what it means to live in women’s bodies - filming their diversity, singularity and their beauty in all stages throughout life.

Unique stories of desires, fears and struggles unfold under Simon's compassionate, unhurried gaze, including the one of the filmmaker herself.

2024-02-04.title: DocHouse: Total Trust
2024-02-04.synopsis:
The full extent of the surveillance state in China is revealed with breathtaking immediacy in this gripping film, which follows the stories of Chinese citizens who have been monitored, intimidated and manipulated by the State.

Total Trust is an unflinching look a system of unbridled state power combined with the advancing capacities of Big Data and AI technology. The most heavily monitored country in the world experiences huge infringements of privacy, (self-)censorship and control, whilst systems such as 'social credit scoring' are being tested and deployed.

Chinese filmmaker Jialing Zhang - now living outside the country since co-directing 2019's One Child Nation - directed this eye-opening exposé remotely, with the support of filmmakers within China, who remain anonymous for their own safety.

Taking China as a mirror, the film sounds an alarm about the increasing use of surveillance tools around the world - even in democratically run countries. If this is the present, what does our future look like?

2024-02-04.title: DocHouse: Dalton's Dream
2024-02-04.synopsis:
In 2018, a young musician from rural Jamaica called Dalton Harris became the first non-British and Black man to win The X Factor UK and, with it, a lucrative record deal that promised to transform his life.

Co-directors Kim Longinotto and Franky Murray Brown chart Dalton's journey as he's catapulted into the limelight and pressure builds from all directions. They capture an extraordinary and talented young man wrestling with the weight of expectations and with his own identity.

Directed by DGA award and five-time Tony award winner George C. Wolfe and starring Emmy award winner Colman Domingo, Rustin shines a long overdue spotlight on the extraordinary man who, alongside giants like the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr., Adam Clayton Powell Jr., and Ella Baker, dared to imagine a different world, and inspired a movement in a march toward freedom. CONTENT WARNING: This film contains flickering or flashing lights that may affect those with photosensitive epilepsy.

2024-02-05.title: My Friend Lanre
2024-02-05.synopsis:
Acclaimed filmmaker Leo Regan draws on decades of footage to create a fascinating portrait of the compelling life of friend and photographer Lanre Fehintola.

Leo Regan and Lanre Fehintola have been friends, photographers and close collaborators for over 25 years. Around the turn of the millennium Lanre’s complex relationship to heroin was documented in two ground-breaking films Don’t Get High on Your Own Supply (1998) and Cold Turkey (2001).

This intensely intimate film follows Lanre as he faces his ultimate challenge, his own terminal illness. Using his extensive archive, Regan presents a tender, funny and deeply moving portrayal of friendship and collaboration; a bravely personal, living testament to one person’s life and work.

2024-02-05.title: WHAM!
2024-02-05.synopsis:
In 1982, the best of friends and still teenagers - George Michael and Andrew Ridgeley as WHAM! set out to conquer the world. By June of 1986 they played their very last gig at Wembley Stadium having done exactly that.

Wolfe, the film features an all-star cast including Chris Rock, Glynn Turman, Jeffrey Wright and Audra McDonald.

2024-02-06.title: Femme
2024-02-06.synopsis: Jules’ (Nathan Stewart-Jarrett) life and career as a drag queen is destroyed by a homophobic attack. But after a chance encounter with his attacker, the deeply closeted Preston (George Mackay), he is presented with the opportunity to exact revenge. Unrecognisable out of his wig and make-up, Jules infiltrates Preston’s life and in doing so discovers the lines of seduction, revenge and power are blurred.

2024-02-06.title: The Zone of Interest
2024-02-06.synopsis: The commandant of Auschwitz, Rudolf Höss, and his wife Hedwig, strive to build a dream life for their family in a house and garden next to the camp.

2024-02-06.title: Anyone But You
2024-02-06.synopsis: In the comedy Anyone But You, Bea (Sydney Sweeney) and Ben (Glen Powell) look like the perfect couple, but after an amazing first date something happens that turns their fiery hot attraction ice cold - until they find themselves unexpectedly thrust together at a destination wedding in Australia. So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

2024-02-06.title: Napoleon
2024-02-06.synopsis: Napoleon is a spectacle-filled action epic that details the checkered rise and fall of the iconic French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, played by Oscar®-winner Joaquin Phoenix. Against a stunning backdrop of large-scale filmmaking orchestrated by legendary director Ridley Scott, the film captures Bonaparte's relentless journey to power through the prism of his addictive, volatile relationship with his one true love, Josephine, showcasing his visionary military and political tactics against some of the most dynamic practical battle sequences ever filmed.

2024-02-06.title: Society of the Snow
2024-02-06.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-02-06.title: WHAM!
2024-02-06.synopsis:
In 1982, the best of friends and still teenagers - George Michael and Andrew Ridgeley as WHAM! set out to conquer the world. By June of 1986 they played their very last gig at Wembley Stadium having done exactly that.

Now for the very first time, told in their own words, the amazing story of how in four years they dominated the charts around the world with timeless and classic pop songs. Hit after hit - Club Tropicana, Wake Me Up Before You Go Go, Freedom, I’m Your Man and of course Last Christmas.

Their time in the spotlight was white-hot, becoming the very first western pop act to play in China.

It was a time that both encapsulated and epitomised not just their youth, but also those of the many millions of fans that adored them.

With unprecedented access to both George and Andrew’s personal archive including remarkable and never-before-seen footage, alongside rare, candid and previously unheard interviews, WHAM! charts their incredible journey from school friends to superstars.

2024-02-06.title: Samsara
2024-02-06.synopsis:
Samsara is the Buddhist cycle of death and reincarnation. From the temples of Laos, alongside with teenage monks, we will accompany a soul in its transit from one body to another through the bardo. The words of the "Tibetan Book of the Dead" will be our guide to avoid getting lost in the afterlife. A luminous and sonorous journey that will lead us to reincarnate on the beaches of Zanzibar, where groups of women work in seaweed farms.

CONTENT WARNING: This film contains flickering or flashing lights that may affect those with photosensitive epilepsy.

2024-02-06.title: DocHouse: Dalton's Dream
2024-02-06.synopsis:
In 2018, a young musician from rural Jamaica called Dalton Harris became the first non-British and Black man to win The X Factor UK and, with it, a lucrative record deal that promised to transform his life.

Co-directors Kim Longinotto and Franky Murray Brown chart Dalton's journey as he's catapulted into the limelight and pressure builds from all directions. They capture an extraordinary and talented young man wrestling with the weight of expectations and with his own identity.

2024-02-06.title: DocHouse: Total Trust
2024-02-06.synopsis:
The full extent of the surveillance state in China is revealed with breathtaking immediacy in this gripping film, which follows the stories of Chinese citizens who have been monitored, intimidated and manipulated by the State.

Total Trust is an unflinching look a system of unbridled state power combined with the advancing capacities of Big Data and AI technology. The most heavily monitored country in the world experiences huge infringements of privacy, (self-)censorship and control, whilst systems such as 'social credit scoring' are being tested and deployed.

Chinese filmmaker Jialing Zhang - now living outside the country since co-directing 2019's One Child Nation - directed this eye-opening exposé remotely, with the support of filmmakers within China, who remain anonymous for their own safety.

Taking China as a mirror, the film sounds an alarm about the increasing use of surveillance tools around the world - even in democratically run countries. If this is the present, what does our future look like?

2024-02-06.title: DocHouse: The Disappearance Of Shere Hite
2024-02-06.synopsis:
Feminist researcher Shere Hite changed the discussion around women's sexuality with her groundbreaking studies in the 1970s and 80s, and her books (including The Hite Report) became best-sellers. But both her methodology and her message came under criticism in the backlash from this popularity, and slowly but surely Shere was ridiculed and squeezed out of the mainstream - and eventually out of popular consciousness.

Director Nicole Newnham (Crip Camp) recovers Shere Hite from the margins of history, feminism and academia, exploring the charismatic former model's rise and fall from prominence. Using a treasure trove of archive footage, The Disappearance of Shere Hite transports viewers back to a time of great societal change and transformation around sexuality. It rediscovers a pioneer who has had an unmistakable influence on current conversations around gender and sexuality, and asks what led to Shere's erasure.

2024-02-07.title: Chicken Run: Dawn of the Nugget
2024-02-07.synopsis: After escaping from Tweedy's farm, Ginger and all the chickens living the dream in their peaceful island sanctuary, far from the dangers of the human world.

2024-02-07.title: The Holdovers
2024-02-07.synopsis: From acclaimed director Alexander Payne, The Holdovers follows a curmudgeonly teacher (Paul Giamatti) at a New England prep school who is forced to remain on campus during the holidays to babysit the handful of students with nowhere to go. Eventually he forms an unlikely bond with one of them -- a damaged, brainy troublemaker (newcomer Dominic Sessa) -- and with the school’s head cook, who lost a son in Vietnam (Da’Vine Joy Randolph). With outstanding critical acclaim, The Holdovers is now the winner of 2 Golden Globes for Best Actor (Comedy) for Paul Giamatti and Best Supporting Actress for Da’Vine Joy Randolph.

2024-02-07.title: Rustin
2024-02-07.synopsis: The architect of 1963’s momentous March on Washington, Bayard Rustin was one of the greatest activists and organizers the world has ever known. He challenged authority, never apologized for who he was, what he believed, or who he desired. And he did not back down. He made history, and in turn, he was forgotten. Directed by DGA award and five-time Tony award winner George C. Wolfe and starring Emmy award winner Colman Domingo, Rustin shines a long overdue spotlight on the extraordinary man who, alongside giants like the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr., Adam Clayton Powell Jr., and Ella Baker, dared to imagine a different world, and inspired a movement in a march toward freedom. Produced by Academy award winner Bruce Cohen, Higher Ground's Tonia Davis and George C. Wolfe, the film features an all-star cast including Chris Rock, Glynn Turman, Jeffrey Wright and Audra McDonald.

2024-02-07.title: Poor Things
2024-02-07.synopsis: From filmmaker Yorgos Lanthimos and producer Emma Stone comes the incredible tale and fantastical evolution of Bella Baxter (Stone), a young woman brought back to life by the brilliant and unorthodox scientist Dr. Godwin Baxter (Dafoe).

2024-02-07.title: All Of Us Strangers
2024-02-07.synopsis: One night in his near-empty tower block in contemporary London, Adam (Andrew Scott) has a chance encounter with a mysterious neighbor Harry (Paul Mescal), which punctures the rhythm of his everyday life. As a relationship develops between them, Adam is preoccupied with memories of the past and finds himself drawn back to the suburban town where he grew up, and the childhood home where his parents (Claire Foy and Jamie Bell), appear to be living, just as they were on the day they died, 30 years before.

2024-02-07.title: Argylle
2024-02-07.synopsis:
From the twisted mind of Matthew Vaughn (Kingsman franchise, Kick-Ass) comes Argylle, a razor-witted, reality-bending, globe-encircling spy thriller.

Bryce Dallas Howard (Jurassic World franchise) is Elly Conway, the reclusive author of a series of best-selling espionage novels, whose idea of bliss is a night at home with her computer and her cat, Alfie. But when the plots of Elly’s fictional books—which center on secret agent Argylle and his mission to unravel a global spy syndicate—begin to mirror the covert actions of a real-life spy organization, quiet evenings at home become a thing of the past.

Accompanied by Aiden (Oscar® winner Sam Rockwell), a cat-allergic spy, Elly (carrying Alfie in her backpack) races across the world to stay one step ahead of the killers as the line between Elly’s fictional world and her real one begins to blur.

2024-02-07.title: American Fiction
2024-02-07.synopsis: AMERICAN FICTION is Cord Jefferson's hilarious directorial debut, which confronts our culture’s obsession with reducing people to outrageous stereotypes. Jeffrey Wright stars as Monk, a frustrated novelist who’s fed up with the establishment profiting from “Black” entertainment that relies on tired and offensive tropes. To prove his point, Monk uses a pen name to write an outlandish “Black” book of his own, a book that propels him to the heart of hypocrisy and the madness he claims to disdain.

2024-02-07.title: Maestro
2024-02-07.synopsis: Maestro is a towering and fearless love story chronicling the lifelong relationship between Leonard Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre Cohn Bernstein. A love letter to life and art, Maestro at its core is an emotionally epic portrayal of family and love.

2024-02-07.title: Royal Ballet 2023/24 Season: Manon
2024-02-07.synopsis:
Manon’s brother Lescaut is offering her to the highest bidder when she meets Des Grieux and falls in love. They elope to Paris, but when Monsieur G.M. offers Manon a life of luxury as his mistress she can’t resist. 

With the Lescauts’ encouragement Des Grieux cheats at cards in an attempt to win Monsieur G.M.’s fortune. They are caught. Manon is arrested as a prostitute and deported to New Orleans, followed by Des Grieux. On the run, Manon dies from exhaustion.

2024-02-07.title: The Zone of Interest
2024-02-07.synopsis: The commandant of Auschwitz, Rudolf Höss, and his wife Hedwig, strive to build a dream life for their family in a house and garden next to the camp.

2024-02-07.title: Napoleon
2024-02-07.synopsis: Napoleon is a spectacle-filled action epic that details the checkered rise and fall of the iconic French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, played by Oscar®-winner Joaquin Phoenix. Against a stunning backdrop of large-scale filmmaking orchestrated by legendary director Ridley Scott, the film captures Bonaparte's relentless journey to power through the prism of his addictive, volatile relationship with his one true love, Josephine, showcasing his visionary military and political tactics against some of the most dynamic practical battle sequences ever filmed.

2024-02-07.synopsis: In the comedy Anyone But You, Bea (Sydney Sweeney) and Ben (Glen Powell) look like the perfect couple, but after an amazing first date something happens that turns their fiery hot attraction ice cold - until they find themselves unexpectedly thrust together at a destination wedding in Australia. So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

2024-02-07.title: Society of the Snow
2024-02-07.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-02-07.title: Samsara
2024-02-07.synopsis:

The words of the "Tibetan Book of the Dead" will be our guide to avoid getting lost in the afterlife. A luminous and sonorous journey that will lead us to reincarnate on the beaches of Zanzibar, where groups of women work in seaweed farms.

Now for the very first time, told in their own words, the amazing story of how in four years they dominated the charts around the world with timeless and classic pop songs. Hit after hit - Club Tropicana, Wake Me Up Before You Go Go, Freedom, I’m Your Man and of course Last Christmas.

Total Trust is an unflinching look a system of unbridled state power combined with the advancing capacities of Big Data and AI technology. 2024-02-07.title: DocHouse: Werner Herzog: Radical Dreamer
2024-02-07.synopsis:
Filmmaker, auteur, poet, actor, doomsayer, truth seeker - Werner Herzog has become a legend in his own right, and at 81 still continues to add to his considerable oeuvre.


Radical Dreamer profiles the man who had a 320-ton steamboat hauled over a hill in Peru, who hypnotises his actors, climbs down into volcanoes, talks to murderers on death row, cooks and eats his own shoe and who once - in an almost magical act - walked from Munich to Paris to prevent the death of a film critic he greatly admired. It is stories like these that have made this most remarkable director a cult figure the world over.

This comprehensive portrait by director Thomas von Steinaecke explores Herzog's work, process and everyday life, bringing together rare archive materials and in-depth interviews with the man himself, as well as celebrated collaborators - including Joshua Oppenheimer, Patti Smith, Christian Bale, Nicole Kidman and his wife, Lena Herzog.

2024-02-07.title: DocHouse: Dalton's Dream
2024-02-07.synopsis:
In 2018, a young musician from rural Jamaica called Dalton Harris became the first non-British and Black man to win The X Factor UK and, with it, a lucrative record deal that promised to transform his life.

Co-directors Kim Longinotto and Franky Murray Brown chart Dalton's journey as he's catapulted into the limelight and pressure builds from all directions. They capture an extraordinary and talented young man wrestling with the weight of expectations and with his own identity.

2024-02-08.title: The Zone of Interest
2024-02-08.synopsis: The commandant of Auschwitz, Rudolf Höss, and his wife Hedwig, strive to build a dream life for their family in a house and garden next to the camp.

So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

2024-02-08.title: Napoleon
2024-02-08.synopsis: Napoleon is a spectacle-filled action epic that details the checkered rise and fall of the iconic French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, played by Oscar®-winner Joaquin Phoenix. Against a stunning backdrop of large-scale filmmaking orchestrated by legendary director Ridley Scott, the film captures Bonaparte's relentless journey to power through the prism of his addictive, volatile relationship with his one true love, Josephine, showcasing his visionary military and political tactics against some of the most dynamic practical battle sequences ever filmed.

2024-02-08.title: From Venice To London: Io Capitano
2024-02-08.synopsis: Exclusive preview of the new film from auteur director Matteo Garrone (Gomorrah, Tale of Tales, Dogman). Io Capitano tells the story of the adventurous journey of Seydou and Moussa, two young men who leave Dakar to make their way to Europe. A contemporary Odyssey through the dangers of the desert, the horrors of the detention centers in Libya and the perils of the sea.

2024-02-08.title: Society of the Snow
2024-02-08.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-02-08.title: WHAM!
2024-02-08.synopsis:
In 1982, the best of friends and still teenagers - George Michael and Andrew Ridgeley as WHAM! set out to conquer the world. By June of 1986 they played their very last gig at Wembley Stadium having done exactly that.

Now for the very first time, told in their own words, the amazing story of how in four years they dominated the charts around the world with timeless and classic pop songs. Hit after hit - Club Tropicana, Wake Me Up Before You Go Go, Freedom, I’m Your Man and of course Last Christmas.

Their time in the spotlight was white-hot, becoming the very first western pop act to play in China.

It was a time that both encapsulated and epitomised not just their youth, but also those of the many millions of fans that adored them.

With unprecedented access to both George and Andrew’s personal archive including remarkable and never-before-seen footage, alongside rare, candid and previously unheard interviews, WHAM! charts their incredible journey from school friends to superstars.

2024-02-08.title: My Friend Lanre
2024-02-08.synopsis:
Acclaimed filmmaker Leo Regan draws on decades of footage to create a fascinating portrait of the compelling life of friend and photographer Lanre Fehintola.

Leo Regan and Lanre Fehintola have been friends, photographers and close collaborators for over 25 years. Around the turn of the millennium Lanre’s complex relationship to heroin was documented in two ground-breaking films Don’t Get High on Your Own Supply (1998) and Cold Turkey (2001).

This intensely intimate film follows Lanre as he faces his ultimate challenge, his own terminal illness. Using his extensive archive, Regan presents a tender, funny and deeply moving portrayal of friendship and collaboration; a bravely personal, living testament to one person’s life and work.

2024-02-08.title: Samsara
2024-02-08.synopsis:
Samsara is the Buddhist cycle of death and reincarnation. From the temples of Laos, alongside with teenage monks, we will accompany a soul in its transit from one body to another through the bardo. The words of the "Tibetan Book of the Dead" will be our guide to avoid getting lost in the afterlife. A luminous and sonorous journey that will lead us to reincarnate on the beaches of Zanzibar, where groups of women work in seaweed farms.

CONTENT WARNING: This film contains flickering or flashing lights that may affect those with photosensitive epilepsy.

2024-02-08.title: DocHouse: Dalton's Dream
2024-02-08.synopsis:
In 2018, a young musician from rural Jamaica called Dalton Harris became the first non-British and Black man to win The X Factor UK and, with it, a lucrative record deal that promised to transform his life.

Co-directors Kim Longinotto and Franky Murray Brown chart Dalton's journey as he's catapulted into the limelight and pressure builds from all directions. They capture an extraordinary and talented young man wrestling with the weight of expectations and with his own identity.

2024-02-08.title: DocHouse: Robin Hood Gardens
2024-02-08.synopsis:
A utopian idea for modern living is demolished, and the documentary Robin Hood Gardens searches the rubble for visions of a bygone era and the reasons for its failure.


Robin Hood Gardens, the brutalist council estate in East London, was unloved by its first residents in 1972, and was lauded and loathed in equal measure by internationally renowned architects, critics and social commentators. The British architects Alison & Peter Smithson failed with their grand, utopian vision for better living, but what is really behind the ostracized facade?


With the participation of residents, experts and critics, and collaborations with Harvard University, the V&A and the Venice Biennale, Robin Hood Gardens paints a polychromatic portrait of this building complex, reappraising the intentions behind it and the backlash against it, in search of answers about the failing of modernism.

2024-02-08.title: DocHouse: Total Trust
2024-02-08.synopsis:
The full extent of the surveillance state in China is revealed with breathtaking immediacy in this gripping film, which follows the stories of Chinese citizens who have been monitored, intimidated and manipulated by the State.

Total Trust is an unflinching look a system of unbridled state power combined with the advancing capacities of Big Data and AI technology. The most heavily monitored country in the world experiences huge infringements of privacy, (self-)censorship and control, whilst systems such as 'social credit scoring' are being tested and deployed.

Chinese filmmaker Jialing Zhang - now living outside the country since co-directing 2019's One Child Nation - directed this eye-opening exposé remotely, with the support of filmmakers within China, who remain anonymous for their own safety.

Taking China as a mirror, the film sounds an alarm about the increasing use of surveillance tools around the world - even in democratically run countries. If this is the present, what does our future look like?

2024-02-09.title: From Venice To London: Felicità (Happiness)
2024-02-09.synopsis: This is the story of a broken family, of egotistic and manipulative parents, a two-headed monster that devours every hope of freedom on the part of the children. Desirè is the only one who can save her brother Claudio and will go on fighting against everything and everyone in the name of the only love she knows, in pursuit of a bit of happiness.

2024-02-09.title: The Zone of Interest
2024-02-09.synopsis: The commandant of Auschwitz, Rudolf Höss, and his wife Hedwig, strive to build a dream life for their family in a house and garden next to the camp.

2024-02-09.title: DocHouse: Motherland
2024-02-09.synopsis:
Winner of the top prize at CPH:DOX 2023, this monumental film from Belarus paints a dark and disturbing picture of the country's brutal military culture. A 'tradition' of violent bullying of new conscripts creates generational trauma deeply embedded in the country's present day culture.

Encompassing the personal and the political, filmmakers Alexander Mihalkovich and Hanna Badziaka capture a snapshot of a troubled, modern-day Belarus through the real-life experiences of mothers and new conscripts, overlaid with the raw voices of those who have gone before them, taken from their private letters home.

2024-02-09.title: DocHouse: Your Fat Friend
2024-02-09.synopsis:
Made over 6 years, acclaimed director Jeanie Finlay charts the rise of writer and activist Aubrey Gordon from anonymous blogger to NYTimes bestselling author and beloved podcaster.

Her searingly honest writing describes what it’s like to be that fat person on the plane... and how the fantasies, peddled by a diet and wellness industry worth $26 billion a year are on a par with the lies that Big Tobacco told the public in the 1950s.

Her aim? A paradigm shift in the way we see fat people and the fat on our own bodies. Her life changing work has brought her an ardent, international audience but also threats to her life.

Your Fat Friend is a film about fatness, family, the complexities of change and the deep, messy feeling we hold about our bodies.

2024-02-10.title: From Venice To London: Lubo
2024-02-10.synopsis: Franz Rogowski stars as Lubo, a nomad and busker who in 1939 is called up to the Swiss army to defend the country’s borders against the risk of a German invasion. Shortly afterward he finds out that his wife has died in the attempt to stop the gendarmes from taking away their three small children, who, as Yenisch, have been removed from their family as part of the national program of reeducation for “children of the road” (Hilfswerk für die Kinder der Landstrasse). Lubo knows that he will never have peace until he gets his children back and gets justice for his story and that of all outsiders like himself.

2024-02-10.title: The Zone of Interest
2024-02-10.synopsis: The commandant of Auschwitz, Rudolf Höss, and his wife Hedwig, strive to build a dream life for their family in a house and garden next to the camp.

2024-02-10.title: Kids Club: Peppa’s Cinema Party
2024-02-10.synopsis: Come on everybody it’s time for Peppa’s Cinema Party! This year Peppa Pig celebrates her 20th anniversary and to mark such a HUGE occasion she is throwing the MOST EPIC PARTY EVER – and all of her friends are INVITED! (That’s YOU!) Featuring the voices of Katy Perry as Ms. Leopard and Orlando Bloom as Mr. Raccoon in an episode of the 3-part Wedding Party story, the whole family can enjoy 10 never-before-seen Peppa Pig episodes! And with 5 brand new songs, as well as 11 interactive entertainment shorts with Peppa and her friends playing, dancing and singing in the real world, you and your little ones will be moving and grooving with Peppa in a whole new way!  So grab your coat and jump into your boots, let’s be on our way to the Peppa Cinema Party!

2024-02-10.title: DocHouse: Motherland
2024-02-10.synopsis:
Winner of the top prize at CPH:DOX 2023, this monumental film from Belarus paints a dark and disturbing picture of the country's brutal military culture. A 'tradition' of violent bullying of new conscripts creates generational trauma deeply embedded in the country's present day culture.

Encompassing the personal and the political, filmmakers Alexander Mihalkovich and Hanna Badziaka capture a snapshot of a troubled, modern-day Belarus through the real-life experiences of mothers and new conscripts, overlaid with the raw voices of those who have gone before them, taken from their private letters home.

2024-02-10.title: DocHouse: Your Fat Friend
2024-02-10.synopsis:
Made over 6 years, acclaimed director Jeanie Finlay charts the rise of writer and activist Aubrey Gordon from anonymous blogger to NYTimes bestselling author and beloved podcaster.

Her searingly honest writing describes what it’s like to be that fat person on the plane... and how the fantasies, peddled by a diet and wellness industry worth $26 billion a year are on a par with the lies that Big Tobacco told the public in the 1950s.

Her aim? A paradigm shift in the way we see fat people and the fat on our own bodies. Her life changing work has brought her an ardent, international audience but also threats to her life.

Your Fat Friend is a film about fatness, family, the complexities of change and the deep, messy feeling we hold about our bodies.
